Job description

Veolia Australia & New Zealand (Veolia) is the only global company to provide a full range of environmental services in the fields of water solutions, waste management solutions and energy solutions.

With the global expertise gained from serving the environment for more than 150 years, Veolia operates in more than 40 countries around the world, with well over a hundred sites and approximately 4000 employees in Australia.

Veolia, being at the centre of this century’s biggest challenges, offers opportunities to make a difference, for your career and also for the environment and our community. In Australia and New Zealand, Veolia works with heavy industry, retail and commercial businesses, governments and communities to deliver innovative and sustainable solutions that are needed today, with the vision required for tomorrow.

We are currently seeking an experienced Heavy Rigid Driver to join our Solid Waste transport team to operate a Heavy Rigid waste truck based out of our Woodonga depot. You’ll be responsible for the safe collection and disposal of various bins from client sites across metropolitan Melbourne.

Details Of This Position Include
  • A full-time position with an immediate start
  • Training
  • Early starts
  • Some weekend work may be required
  • Recent model, fully maintained vehicles
  • Safe working practices
  • Company supplied uniforms

To Be Considered For This Role, You Must Have
  • A valid HR Drivers license with a clean driving record
  • At least 12 months experience in driving Heavy Rigid vehicles
  • A strong safety focused
  • A strong work ethic
  • Strong knowledge of Melbourne Metro area
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Good literacy skills

As part of our usual recruitment process applicants may be requested to undergo a police check and a medical examination, including a drug and alcohol test.

If you feel you would be suited to this role please click the "Apply now" button.

Veolia Australia & New Zealand is an equal opportunity employer.

Job description

Stock Room Specialist, adidas Uni Hill Factory Outlet Store

Dedicated to being the best sports brand in the world, adidas has a continued commitment to its people and to making our superior products better.

The Stockroom Specialist is responsible for our operations & logistics function within our adidas store. The roles are fast-paced and will suit organized, efficient and pro-active candidates.

Stockroom Specialist Key Responsibilities
  • Accepting & receipting all new stock, ensuring it is on the shop floor within 24 hours
  • Ensuring daily replenishment of shop floor is accurate & efficient
  • Managing all logistics of the stock room including layout and staff when required
  • Ensuring all receipting, transfers and orders are completed accurately
  • Any errors or anomalies in stock control are investigated and corrected within 24 hours
  • Managing the Stocktake process over the 12 month period including weekly cycle counts
  • Work with the Store Manager in maintaining stock on hand targets within key categories
  • Lead by example on the shop floor in providing exceptional customers service when required


Stockroom Specialist Requirements

To be successful in your application, you will have strong retail stock control experience in a fast-paced retail environment, be passionate about providing operational and logistical leadership in a fast-paced retail business.

Experience In The Following Will Also Be Highly Regarded
  • Retail Apparel / Footwear Stock Control or night fill experience

In brief, this is a high-performance position that will be very visible to the rest of the business. We are seeking people who share our passion for Sport, who contribute to the team, seek challenges and embrace change. If you are looking to take the next step in your career with an iconic brand and prioritise a supportive, unique and challenging work environment, we would love to hear from you.

What’s on offer?

A competitive annual salary, retail bonus scheme and adidas employee benefits are also on offer to the successful candidate

910964385:
[

Process Improvement Analyst | RPA

Company Name Reveal Group Company Location Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 92 views

Job description

Looking for an exciting opportunity to work within the Intelligent Automation space and provide support for leading Operational Excellence software? Keen to support clients at top-tiers organisations around the world?\xa0Ready to build a career with the 1st pure-play partner to be recognised as a Gold Blue Prism Capability Provider, globally?


As a Process Analyst, you will work with our clients to document their existing processes, analyse them for identifying improvement areas & make them suitable for robotic process automation. You will be an experienced process analyst with a natural ability to influence and collaborate with stakeholders to support and drive operational efficiencies using the latest technologies. Whether you're a Lean / Six Sigma practitioner, or a future-minded Process Consultant looking for the best on-the-job training on Robotic Process Automation, we would love to speak with you.

\xa0

Reveal Group are Blue Prism specialists, having worked together since 2014. We have the largest number of accredited Professional Developers in Australia and have implemented Blue Prism for clients in more than 20 industries across the USA, UK, Australia, Canada, South Africa and Asia. Our unique approach leverages our experience, IP and training to quickly build client capability and self-sufficiency. Organisations look to us to start and scale their Blue Prism programs. We are one of only 5 Gold partners, globally.

\xa0

You are passionate about:

  • Improving business performance through the application of cutting-edge technologies
  • Building effective relationships with key stakeholders through strong communication skills
  • Time management and attention to detail
  • Thinking on your feet and embracing new challenges as they arrive
  • Contributing to the successful delivery of projects
  • Constantly seeking new challenges and opportunities
  • Being part of and contributing to the growth and success of a leading global business improvement consultancy


Your key responsibilities:

  • Working side-by-side with clients to implement operations improvement programs
  • Running organizational process diagnostic workshops to identify processes suitable for process automation
  • Business processes re-engineering to make processes streamlined for future process automation
  • Using Lean / Six Sigma methodologies to eliminate waste, induce efficiencies & minimize manual inputs to processes
  • Analysing and documenting client processes
  • Business process mapping by conducting ‘AS-IS’ analysis to identify impediments to automation and design improvements in the ‘TO-BE’ processes
  • Business requirements elicitation from business stakeholders and SMEs using techniques such as workshops, interviews, observation and surveys.
  • Root cause analysis and gap analysis by conducting solution workshops with SMEs
  • Assess process performance and ultimate delivery of value to process owners and ensure performance expectation is met
  • Change impact assessment of recommended process improvements
  • Implementing robotic process automation solutions (Reveal Group provide extensive RPA training and accreditation)
  • Effective engagement of all Stakeholders (Project Manager, Client SMEs)
  • Identifying, tracking and monitoring project deliverables to ensure successful project completion
  • Facilitating training workshops on operations management and process improvement & automation
  • Providing on-going support and expertise to clients

\xa0

Your skills & experience:

  • Undergraduate degree in business, IT, engineering, mathematics, science or other relevant discipline is required
  • 2-3 years of experience in a similar role such as Process Improvement Consultant, Six Sigma Business Analyst or Process Analyst
  • Track record of delivering business improvement initiatives in the service sector (banking, insurance, financial services, telecommunication, retail) through the application of Lean Six Sigma and project management tools
  • Experience and/or certification with Blue Prism, UiPath, Automation Anywhere are a plus
  • Being a highly talented problem-solver
  • Strong communication skills – both oral and written (fluency in English is mandatory and a second language is beneficial)
  • Capacity to think on your feet and embrace new challenges as they arise

\xa0

Other requirements:

  • Residency and work visas in Australia/New Zealand
  • Preparedness to travel both within Australia and internationally
  • Eligibility to pass background checks that may be required for key clients


What's in it for you?
Located in fantastic CBD location, \xa0you'll work in an incredibly fun and rewarding business that prides itself on its unique culture and family mentality. We genuinely love working together. You’ll receive an attractive salary and opportunities to constantly learn and upskill, with limitless opportunities.


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Reveal Group. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

\xa0

If you like the sound of this role, we'd love to hear from you!
To apply, please attach your resume and a cover letter outlining what you’ll bring to the position.

Job description

  • Teaching & Learning College team – Box Hill location
  • Full Time, Ongoing position

About The Role

The Teaching and Learning Specialist is responsible as part of a team for implementing programs to enhance teaching performance and development and, the achievement of new standards in teaching excellence in the area of Adult Education.

The role will evaluate current quality teaching practices and process to provide advice, peer review, mentoring, information and support to teachers and Managers that will enhance the BHI Group’s standards in quality teaching excellence and innovation.

The role is part of team of three Specialists, within the Teaching and Learning College. As part of teacher development programs, the Teaching and Learning Specialist delivers TAE training products, structured teaching and learning courses, implements organisational peer review programs and builds staff knowledge and capacity with respect to Blended and On-Line Digital (BOLD) learning capabilities. Regular evening teaching will be required to meet the availability needs of Box Hill Institute staff.

As part of the Teaching and Learning College team, the Teaching and Learning Sspecialist works on process projects to build teamwork and collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.

Your Skills And Experience

 Essential credential:
TAE50111 or TAE50116 Diploma of Vocational Education and Training, or
  • TAE50211 or TAE50216 Diploma of Training Design and Development
  • Preferred additional credential:
  • A Masters Qualification (or working towards a Masters qualification) in Education or equivalent is strongly preferred.
  • Digital skills – Ability to utilise different online learning management platforms and software to aid delivery of training and workshops, both nationally and internationally
  • Innovation - Proven ability to deliver innovative solutions and programs including the use of Student Web.
  • Quality Assurance - Demonstrated understanding of the principles of quality assurance and continuous improvement and their application in a complex education and training organisation and sector.
    • Vocational Experience – Demonstrated experience working in teacher education is required
    Interpersonal Skills - Excellent interpersonal, conflict management, negotiation and problem solving skills with demonstrated ability to establish positive organisational relationships.
    People Management - Demonstrated ability to lead and motivate people to achieve the objectives and targets.
    Influence and Negotiation - Demonstrated ability to build buy-in and support from key internal and external clients/stakeholders to achieve desired outcomes.
  • Industry Partnerships - Ability to establish, develop and maintain productive relationships with clients and prospective clients.

    Benefits

    Interested in starting a career with one of Australia's leading Institutes? At BHI Group we value our people. We offer more than just a job; we offer benefits to enhance your work life, help you grow, and celebrate your achievements.

Support Coordinator - Employment Pathways - Wyndham

Company Name MatchWorks Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 8 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About GenU

genU is short for Generation You. Because whatever generation you belong to, whether you’re young, old, or somewhere in between, what unites us is the belief that neither disability nor ageing are disadvantages to be endured but challenges to be met boldly, achievements to be had and adventures in the making.

genU has been 60 years in the making. Bringing together the best of two trusted and respected organisations, Karingal and St Laurence, genU builds on this experience, adding a new ambition: to become the leader in what we do.

About The Role

The Support Coordinator - Employment Pathways will oversee a series of activities that can be packaged into ‘employment pathways’ options which will be funded by the NDIS. These activities may be conducted by the Employment Pathways team as well as other branches across genU and MatchWorks.

Responsibilities of this role will include, but are not limited to:
  • Assessing the pre-employment and employment needs of people with disabilities and then preparing them for work, assisting them to achieve employment and supporting them to maintain employment.
  • Develop an employment plan for each of the participants including a range of activities that can be delivered by genU branches. External activities may also be included in the plan
  • Utilise a range of services across genU which will assist people with disabilities to prepare for and achieve open employment
  • Coordinate and broker a range of activities for participants as per their Employment plan


About You

To be successful in this role you will have:
  • A strong commitment to inclusion of people with disabilities within the community
  • Excellent communication skills and demonstrated ability to engage a wider range of stakeholders
  • Self motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision
  • Strong time management skills and a flexible attitude to post responsibilities
  • Excellent computer skills including familiarity with MS applications
  • Current driver’s license

Tertiary qualifications in disability, community services, employment services or a related field would be desirable

Benefits
  • Career opportunities and development
  • Employee assistance program including a dietician service
  • Salary Packaging Benefits

Please click the link below to view the Position Description outlining full details of this role:

For further details please contact Jaime-Lee Demmer on (03) 9974 9671

Job description


A rare and exciting opportunity has arisen to appoint a Data & Process Analyst, based in Notting Hill, VIC and forming part of the OAZ Finance team. Reporting to the Finance Operations Manager, you will support and maintain master data structures, hierarchies and data quality within the organisation. Additionally, you will ensure master data integrity in SAP as well as maintaining business process management cross-functionally to support the quality of the data.

Working together with the Master Data Business Analyst, you are to provide support to administer and perform accurate and timely data entry in our systems, creating, maintaining and deleting business critical master data elements as required.

Looking after you:
We are committed to ensuring our people are well looked after. In addition to a rewarding and challenging career, we promise to provide you:

  • Competitive package including superannuation and performance bonus;
  • Participation in our Reward and Recognition Program 'Shining Stars';
  • Free undercover onsite parking;
  • Purchased Annual leave benefits; and
  • Access to our employee assistance program.


All about you:
To be considered for this opportunity, you will have demonstrated experience in a similar role. Key to our requirements is have working knowledge of SAP. Use of other business systems (CRM, ERP etc.) will also be accepted however prior use of SAP is mandatory. You will remain calm when under pressure, and you will contribute to the team's success by offering a supportive and adaptable approach. Sound computer literacy along with exceptional attention to detail, strong communication and organisational skills are a must. Should you possess experience within an FMCG environment in a similar role your application will be held in high regard.

Finally, your high level of initiative and self-motivation coupled with an ability to take the lead and make decisions will enable you to shine in this role.

Our common values of Integrity, Empathy, Long-Term View, Agility and Unity form the foundation of our culture and guide our behaviour - empowering us. This is how we make people's lives healthier, safer and more fulfilling.

Senior Finance Officer

Company Name Australian Institute of Family Studies Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 9 hours ago Number of views 17 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Senior Finance Officer

APS Level 5–6

Full-time or Part Time

Non-ongoing

\xa0

We are the Australian Institute of Family Studies (AIFS), the Australian Government’s key independent research body and advisor in the area of family wellbeing, based in Melbourne. Our work increases understanding about the factors that help Australian families thrive, or that are barriers to their wellbeing. We produce research about ‘what works for families’ and make it accessible to decision makers, practitioners and the general public.

\xa0

The Finance Team is responsible for managing all strategic and operational financial activities and functions for the Institute. The team supports the Institutes’ leaders to develop budgets and forecasts, and to report against the strategic goals that determine the Institutes’ future directions. As such, the Finance Team embodies our organisational values and behaviours.

\xa0

Are you keen to put your strong experience with accounting standards, legislation and regulations to the test? This role is for you if you have:

  • strong experience in the budget preparation processes
  • sound experience in preparation of financial statements, account reconciliation and variance analysis
  • strong communication skills, and the ability to work well independently as well as part of a small team
  • a business and customer focus
  • a track record in pro-active problem solving.

\xa0

Under the direction of the Chief Financial Officer, you will:

  • ensure the accuracy of data in the Financial Management Information System (TechOne experience an advantage)
  • prepare monthly and annual financial statements
  • complete monthly variance analysis and reconciliations
  • manage the cash position.

\xa0

Accounting qualifications or significant progression towards them, as well as CPA or CA membership are highly desirable.

\xa0

The role will be offered on a non-ongoing basis for up to 18 months at APS Level 5–6 with a salary range of $71,357 to $87,948 per annum (full-time equivalent), with the possibility of extension to a maximum term of three years.

\xa0

How to apply for this job

Download a full Position Description at https://aifs.gov.au/about-us/working-aifs/jobs.

Email your CV and covering letter together with an AIFS application form to jobs@aifs.gov.au.

Applications close Sunday 21 October 2018.

For further information, contact Human Resources on (03) 9214 7888.


The Institute welcomes applications from the diverse Australian community including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and people with disability, people of all ages and those from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.

  • Melbourne CBD Location

About Us

RSM is the 6th largest network of independent audit, tax and consulting firms, encompassing over 120 countries, 800 offices and more than 43,000 people internationally. We have 30 offices throughout Australia and offer personalised services with in-depth expertise and resources in the accountancy, business consulting and risk management areas.

The Opportunity

Due to growth, our Melbourne Risk Advisory division is currently seeking an experienced and enthusiastic Audit Senior or Assistant Manager to join their friendly and supportive team. This position would suit a motivated individual with proven experience in internal audit.

Key Responsibilities Of The Role Include
  • Conducting various audit and assurance engagements simultaneously with numerous engagement team members per audit, including assisting with planning, execution and scheduling staff;
  • Assist in the planning of client deliverables (i.e. strategic internal audit plan, scope documents);
  • Responsible for the execution of fieldwork and documentation of work papers and findings (i.e. maintain the audit file);
  • Identifying and referriong ethical, accounting and conflict issues to manager and/or partner;
  • Summarising the key areas of the engagement for the partner;
  • Identification of findings and issues, and assisting in the drafting of client reports;
  • Assist in business development activities of the firm;
  • Coordination with other divisions;
  • Address technical issues and assist in preparing technical position papers;
  • Undertaking development of team members; and
  • Assisting with management and co-ordination of the audit team including training, mentoring and methodology compliance.
The Successful Applicant
To be considered for this role you must be able to demonstrate the following:
  • Qualified as a Chartered Accountant or near completion;
  • Business / Commerce degree;
  • 2-5 years professional practice experience;
  • IT audit capability or experience (desirable);
  • Well-developed organisational and time management skills;
  • Ability to build rapport with a variety of clients and colleagues;
  • Outstanding communication (verbal and written) skills, including report writing skills
  • Strong attention to detail;
  • Problem solving and decision making skills;
  • Advanced computer skills using Microsoft Products;
  • Working knowledge and application of Australian Audit and Assurance Standards and other applicable legislation; and
  • Flexibility to operate across a wide variety of clients and industries, and to quickly grasp new concepts.

What's On Offer

In this role you will be working within a national Firm and be mentored by experienced Internal Audit practitioners. You will have direct access to and work closely with the Partners and a wide variety of clients and assignments.

RSM provides our employees with the opportunity to connect for success through our culture, employee benefits and an environment that supports work life balance. On offer is a competitive opportunity for personal and professional development and a friendly and supportive environment.

If you're ready for your next career challenge then apply today for this great opportunity.

Project Manager - Clinical Quality Registry

Company Name Movember Foundation Company Location Level 4, 21-31 Goodwood Street, Richmond, VIC 3121, AU

New Posted Date Posted 9 hours ago Number of views 29 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • A Fixed Term Project Manager contract role based in Melbourne;
  • Project management of a major national clinical database that Movember funds to support our national & global clinical quality registry programmes;
  • Support the successful procurement and implementation of the new database.


The Movember Foundation is the leading global organisation committed to changing the face of men’s health. Together, we do everything with our values and missions top of mind and these values are at the heart of everything we do;


Fun; We have fun doing good;

Respect; We are caring & inclusive;

Humble; We should never forget why we are here;

Team Movember; We enable every person to be their best;

Remarkable Experience; We create remarkable experiences for our people & community;

Change Agent; We must think & act differently to have an everlasting impact on the face of men’s health.

\xa0

Purpose of this position


An exciting opportunity exists for a Project Manager who can plan, champion, facilitate and support the successful selection and implementation of the cancer clinical database that Movember funds to support our national and global clinical quality registry programmes. \xa0

Reporting to the Global Director of Clinical Quality, your role as Project Manager will be primarily responsible for working closely with our strategic partners to outline and define an agreed project scope. You will identify and articulate the business requirements and project needs, whilst working alongside our team to understand the business and technical inputs.


Your Key duties will include


  • Setting up the project to support the procurement and implementation of a national clinical quality database;
  • Outline the project schedule, ensuring work is estimated, and aligns with business expectations;
  • Build strong relationships with strategic partners and internal Movember stakeholders
  • Provide support to business and technology leadership teams
  • Facilitate the development and management of a project budget and associated risks;


To be considered for this opportunity, you must have;

  • Demonstrated project management experience at a senior level in the implementation of digital healthcare solutions, including technology, business and user needs;
  • Significant experience working with technology vendors;
  • An outstanding track record of implementing and project management of software development and solutions across complex environments;
  • Experience delivering projects across commercial partnership arrangements;
  • Advanced organisational skills and excellent prioritising skills;
  • Experience and exposure to a fast paced/growth environment;
  • Demonstrated experience establishing exceptional and effective working relationships.

\xa0

To apply for this role:

Please submit a resume and cover letter to jobs@movember.com by Friday, 19 October 2018.


Only candidates entitled to work in Australia should apply. (Note: the LinkedIn 'Apply' button only allows one document to be uploaded).\xa0

International Sales Manager

\xa0

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Globally successful women’s fashion powerhouse

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Take on existing accounts as well as driving new business

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Clear development and progression opportunities

\xa0

About the role
We’re recruiting for a luxury womenswear brand that’s famous for its highly coveted dresses and use of beautiful detail. The brand partners with an enviable portfolio of luxury websites, department stores and high-end boutiques both domestically and overseas.

\xa0

Culturally, this is a high-performance business that is constantly seeking to innovate and improve. It will be suited to candidates who are solutions driven and aspire to work for a fast-growing company.


Due to the continued demand from overseas retail partners, the business has decided to expand its international offering.


To make this happen, we’re on the hunt for a savvy salesperson who can help build the brand in Europe. You’ll be responsible for growing existing accounts as well as mapping out and bringing on new business.


You’ll spend most of your time partnering with the GM to devise an international strategy, driving sales with both new and existing accounts, using your analytical skills to pull together budgets and forecasts, and partnering with the marketing team to build your brands overseas.

This is a great opportunity to join a financially successful and growing business that has already demonstrated its success in key markets.


The role will be a good match for anyone with a clear background in international wholesale sales. The candidate will ideally come from a premium or luxury apparel background. Experience selling into European buyers will also be strongly favoured.


In return, you’ll get to work with an iconic brand and fantastic people. They’ll also offer you clear development and progression opportunities.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Brand building – communicate key marketing messaging.

912651275:
[

Brand Manager

Company Name Boundary Bend Limited Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 13 hours ago Number of views 71 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Opportunity

This newly created position will allow you to truly make your mark and contribute to the success of an Iconic Australian business within the Wellness division.

\xa0

  • Diverse role with the chance to fast track your career
  • Within the growing category of Health, Wellness and Nutrition
  • Dynamic, down-to-earth and collaborative company culture

\xa0

Boundary Bend Limited (BBL) is searching for an experienced Brand Manager to plan, launch, manage and monitor the marketing activities for a portfolio of new wellness products in Australia under the Boundary Bend Wellness brand. This role will be responsible for making decisions on strategy and executing key marketing initiatives! The role will be the face of Boundary Bend Wellness at leading events and communicating with external stakeholders.

\xa0

The Company & Values

Boundary Bend Limited (BBL) is Australia’s largest olive farmer and producer of extra virgin olive oil. BBL’s world class olive groves, located in Victoria’s Murray River Valley, are flagship groves in the Australian industry with over 2.5 million trees on over 6,240 hectares of pristine Australian farmland. BBL is the leading marketer of premium Australian extra virgin olive oil and owns Australia’s two top-selling home grown olive oil brands, Cobram Estate and Red Island. BBL are also a manufacturer of olive harvesters; owners of Australia’s largest olive tree nursery and olive oil bottling, storage and laboratory facility; and innovators in all aspects of the “new world” olive industry. BBL has bought the values of the farm to the business – passion, honesty, hard-working, high-quality, team work, initiative and resilience. Recently BBL has expanded into the USA with the establishment of an olive mill in California. With an un-wavering focus on superior quality, innovation and customer satisfaction through all facets of their business, BBL is one of the leading players in the modern olive industry.

\xa0

The company’s Wellness division, formed in 2016, leads the company’s sustainability and holistic initiative, using world-class R&D to transform olive ‘waste’ by-products into high value and highly sought-after nutraceutical and cosmeceutical products. Lead by a globally-recognised team of scientists specialising in olive science, and olive health and wellness, together with an expert scientific committee to provide evidence-based guidance on our research activities and product claims, the wellness team have successfully commercialised several unique, superior quality ; speciality ingredients’ and wellness products, all produced from olive products sourced from olive trees from our own farms, With a strong product portfolio and a significant pipeline of new products planned for launch over the next 1-2 years.

\xa0

For more details please visit: www.boundarybend.com; www.boundarybendwellness.com.au, and www.cobramestate.com.au.

\xa0

\xa0

The Role

The role will be based in our Southbank office and report to the Global GM Sales & Marketing. The position will work collaboratively with the sales and marketing teams across AUS & USA. Responsibilities will include (but not limited to) the following activities:


  • Lead the identification of market, category and consumer trends which then drives the yearly brand(s) plans and strategy against agreed Advertising & Promotion (A&P) budget;
  • Work with and across PR, Social & Digital, E-Commerce and Health Care Professional teams linking insights across platforms and driving common messages;
  • Manage & negotiate with agency the media investment for best effectiveness including POS and major activations for key customers;
  • Work with sales team to ensure the price and promotional strategies align with and are coordinated with our marketing strategy to ensure best use of brand support funding;
  • Use all consumer insight tools including IRi data to determine ROI of all activities including trade spend on a minimum monthly basis;
  • Collaborate on productivity projects that deliver cost breakthroughs that don’t negatively impact brand equity;
  • Work with US and AUS counterparts to translate our global brand strategy and positioning into the development and execution of creative marketing strategies that drive brand awareness and sales on shelf in Australia, including all master brand, brand awareness and new product launches, across all channels including social media;
  • Manage further NPD projects for the Wellness brand end to end and be the communication link between R&D, packaging, finance, operations;
  • Ensure Boundary Bend’s authentic and vertically integrated story underpins the brand(s) context; internally through portfolio development and externally with marketing campaigns and comms with relevant stakeholders;
  • \xa0Deliver the Wellness marketing component of the monthly Board Reports and yearly AGM presentations;
  • Management of trademarks for Wellness products.

\xa0

\xa0

Skills & Experience

The role will ideally suit an experienced brand manager with a proactive work ethic. The successful candidate will have relevant FMCG, Health or Pharmacy industry skills and experience and the following qualifications and attributes:

\xa0

  • 3-5 years within a Brand Manager role ideally within FMCG, Health or Pharmacy;
  • Tertiary Qualifications in Marketing or Communication required;
  • Prior NPD experience within an FMCG, Health or Pharmacy business, with local manufacturing;
  • Content strategy creation knowledge and ability to deploy across all social platforms;
  • Experience developing and executing communication campaigns including both ABL and BTL;
  • Understanding of P&L including COGS, margins, componentry and previous exposure to a Marketing budget;
  • High curiosity and exploration of data;
  • Strong project management skills and ability to juggle multiple priorities;
  • Strong relationship building and interpersonal skills for both internal and external stakeholders; \xa0
  • Good understanding of digital PR and eCommerce;
  • Ability to travel across all BBL sites and interstate when required;

\xa0

To attract the best candidates, BBL is offering a competitive remuneration package and the chance to be a part of an Iconic Australian business at an exciting time of growth. If you thrive on working within an integrated sales and marketing team and hungry to succeed – this could be your next role!

\xa0

How to Apply

Please apply with your CV and a brief cover letter addressing the following key points:

\xa0

  1. Your background and interests/qualifications – making you the right candidate for this role
  2. Something unique about your background and experience that you would bring to this role and the BBL team

\xa0

* PLEASE NOTE: WE ARE UNABLE TO ACCEPT TELEPHONE CALLS - PLEASE APPLY THROUGH SEEK.

** Unsolicited CVs from agencies will not be accepted.

Job description

  • Iconic venue in the heart of Melbourne

\xa0

Working within the vibrant precinct of Federation Square it will never feel like just an ordinary workplace as you are surrounded by the creative mix of cultural attractions, world-class events, tourism, and an exceptional array of restaurants, bars, and specialty stores.

\xa0

Federation Square, ranked within the top 10 best public squares in the world, hosts up to 2000 events and activations and has a visitation of 10 million people each year. As a member of our team, you'll receive discounts to selected bars and restaurants within Fed Square, health and well-being offering, and enjoy an architecturally designed office space.

\xa0

The Role

Reporting to the General Manager Corporate Services you will be responsible for business analytics and research, risk management and governance. A key player in business planning and reporting, you will work across the entire organisation leading various initiatives to drive business planning and performance.

\xa0

This position is responsible for both detailed analysis of business performance and the preparation of high-level reporting to the Board and executives on activities that support the strategic direction of the organisation. This role is also responsible for the ongoing development and implementation of risk management, business continuity, privacy and legal compliance frameworks.

\xa0

Your Experience

You could come from a range of backgrounds, including business analytics, planning and/or risk management to name a few and pride yourself on your interpersonal and stakeholder management skills. Your writing, numerical and analytical skills are key strengths and will ensure you achieve meaningful results making this Melbourne icon even greater.

About The ABC

The ABC is the nation's most trusted and independent source of Australian conversations, culture, and stories. With over 4,000 employees from diverse backgrounds across over 50 locations around Australia and overseas, the ABC is proud to create, curate and deliver high-quality content that informs, educates and entertains.

About The Role

The ABC’s Asia Pacific Newsroom (APN) in Melbourne is seeking a Supervising Producer to lead a small and dynamic team producing compelling Chinese and English news content for ABC News audiences at home and abroad. This is a key editorial and strategic role aimed at engaging and growing ABC audiences in target markets.

  • Lead and manage the Chinese language editorial team to produce original, distinctive news stories and feature articles about China and Chinese communities in Australia and overseas.

  • Ensure the delivery of new and improved, mobile-friendly international content and extend the use of platforms popular in the Asia Pacific region.


About You

As an effective people leader together with demonstrated editorial leadership, excellent editorial judgement and significant practical experience as a journalist, you will bring:
  • Excellent news judgement and a proven ability to commission accurate and original news in engaging digital formats.
  • Motivating and inspiring skills to build a strong performing and cohesive team.
  • High level bilingual language skills in English and Mandarin (Cantonese an advantage).

Team Leader - Temporary & Contract

Company Name Toll People Company Location Inner Suburbs Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 6 hours ago Number of views 12 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


Who are we?


The Toll Group is the Asian region's leading provider of integrated logistics services, generating annual revenue of AU$8.3 billion and employing over 40,000 people across an extensive network of 1,200 sites throughout more than 50 countries across the world. We're committed to providing a safe, diverse, satisfying and fulfilling workplace for all of our people. We value integrity, trust, teamwork and being open and transparent.


The opportunity?


As part of Toll Group's new growth strategy, an opportunity has become available within Toll's Group Operational Services division for a Team Leader - Temporary & Contract to join a large, cross functional, internal recruitment team supporting the Toll group of companies.


Reporting to the Recruitment Manager, Executive and Professional, key accountabilities and responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:

  • Leading, coaching and developing the temp recruitment team
  • Working closely with Hiring Managers to ensure deep understanding of role requirements
  • Ensuring effective management of Manager and Candidate relationships throughout the duration of assignments
  • Developing recruitment strategies to support peak requirements including proactive talent sourcing and candidate pipelining
  • Building and maintaining strong internal stakeholder relationships
  • Ensuring the database is maintained in relation to client and candidate activity and that updates to the system occur in a timely manner
  • Ensuring Toll standards are maintained throughout the recruitment and engagement process
  • Adhering to Toll safety standards and ensuring the wellbeing of our temporary employees


The ideal candidate?


The ideal candidate will have significant demonstrated experience as a recruitment team leader in either an internal or agency environment. They will have strong leadership and organisational skills along with the ability to multi task and prioritise.


They will possess exceptional interpersonal, communication, relationship building and stakeholder management skills along with a passion for continuous improvement.


This is a great opportunity for a dynamic individual who understands the importance of candidate care and thinks of out of the box solutions to attract the right candidates to the business.


In return, you will be rewarded with an inclusive and dynamic team environment, a passionate company culture and the opportunity to be an integral part of Toll's new direction.


For further information contact Karen McConachy on 03 9049 4000, or click 'apply now' to submit your application.
